reviews.text: Very very very good off ramp right to the Ramada - Saco,Maine and I got to meet ''Tom" at the front desk and he was very very kind and worked with me too. Thank You Tom. I had left my cell phone at home and wanted to use the phone @ The Ramade - Saco and Tom was more than willing and understood my situation. Now days can most often not find a phone booth. So again want to ank. ''Tom'' for his good work. And most important - when in Portland,Maine area I know I will think of Tom @ Ramada,Saco - just off the hwy.
reviews.title: Stop off the Hwy.

reviews.text: I stayed for one night at this hotel. I was in room 211.
reviews.title: Ramada

reviews.text: The room - it was clean. It had a fridge and a microwave, which I paid $10 extra for. I also had a crib, also $10 additional. My son wouldn't sleep in the crib. He is 2.5 years old, and the crib was a bit flimsy and small for him. The toilet was a bit clogged, to the point that it filled to the rim before the water level went down. I told housekeeping and they sent someone right up, but he couldn't get it unclogged, so I told him to come back after I had checked out. The room was very warm, I didn't have to turn the heat on. Oh, I had no hot or even warm water when I went to take a shower in the morning. When I mentioned this at check out the clerk said other guests had also mentioned this, so they had turned it up. Great for the next guests, but really didn't help me much. He did apologize, in a very standard, rehearsed manner.

reviews.text: The hotel does offer a free continental breakfast. It is the standard items you find. Bagels, toast, scrambled/hard boiled eggs. Cereal, oatmeal, coffee, tea, juice, milk. Nothing above and beyond.
reviews.title: FREEZING

reviews.text: This hotel does allow pets. When I was leaving the hotel there was a dog standing in front of the door, not on a leash. I think the owner was at the front desk. The owner didn't call the dog, or say anything to me, like, oh don't worry hes friendly. So I made my way past the dog, hoping also that it didn't run out when I opened the door.
reviews.title: Top of the line service

reviews.text: Time after time our meetings receive the utmost attention and service. The Biddeford+Saco Chamber of Commerce & Industry proudly endorses the outstanding quality of the Ramada Saco first hand! From the minute you enter this establishment you know that you will be totally satisfied with from start to finish! Thank you Ramada Saco!
reviews.title: Excellence has another name ~> Ramada Saco

reviews.text: This Ramada is a good deal for proximity to I-95 and the University of New England in Biddeford, ME. I was most impressed with the cleanliness of the room/bathroom, and the continental breakfast selection. The bathroom vent was exceptionally loud and jarring, though, and I could smell cigarette smoke coming into the bathroom even though I was in a non-smoking room. The rooms do offer flat screen TVs but not an HD connection so the quality is quite poor. While I personally drove up from Boston, I know 3 other applicants utilized the free shuttle service from the airport and to UNE. The only negative is that the hotel did not answer their calls to be picked up from UNE, and I utlimately drove them back to the hotel. Also to keep in mind, there are 2 separated parking lots for this hotel, one that can be accessed from I-95 only, and the other only from North Street/Saco.
reviews.title: Solid Option for UNE Applicant Interviews

description: Welcome to the Ramada Saco, Maine. Our hotel is in Southern Maine and 5 mile from Old Orchard Beach. We are Saco's only Hotel & Conference Center featuring 4,000 square feet of meeting & conference space. Ramada Saco invites you to enjoy our beautifully decorated and spacious guestrooms. Enjoy our deluxe full hot continental breakfast, seasonal outdoor heated pool, free in-room wired high speed Internet access, on site laundry facilities, free local calls, free daily newspaper, Wyndham Rewards and so much more! Traveling on business or pleasure? Our hotel is located next door to Southern Maine Sportszone and across the street from Maine Hockey Group Ice Arena, home of the Portland Jr. Pirates. We are minutes away from the Biddeford Crossing Shopping Center along with University of New England. The Maine Mall located in Portland is 10 miles North, and the World famous L.L. Bean Flagship Store & Freeport Outlets is 30 miles North, don t forget about the Kittery Outlets just 35 miles South of the hotel. While visiting the beautiful Southern Maine Coast enjoy some of our local Festivals throughout the season. Saco/Old Orchard/Biddeford offers Beaches, Golf, Ice Skating, X-Country Skiing, Amusement Parks, & Saco Museum. Visit Walker Point in Kennebunkport enjoying more shopping & fine dining.
